question: Which one of the following is not a feature of the Government of India Act of 1935?
option1: Diarchy at the Centre as well as in the provinces
answer: Diarchy at the Centre as well as in the provinces
explanation: Diarchy was introduced at the Provincial Level. Diarchy means a dual set of governments; one is accountable, the other is not accountable. Subjects of provincial government were divided into two groups. Dyarchy, also spelled diarchy, system of double government introduced by the Government of India Act (1919) for the provinces of British India.
